Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of komast (head, chest, and right arm remaining) to left with garment in added red; above, black band at junction of neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd is also published in Seeberg, A., Corinthian Komos Vases. London 1971, 54, no.U120 and Amyx, D. A., Corinthian vase-painting of the Archaic period. California 1988, 200, no. 5. Seeberg (1971, 54) assigns the vessel to a painter in the Klyka Group. The sherd may belong to the same vessel as Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA174, British Museum 1924,1201.1305, 1924,1201.1304 and 1924,1201.1155.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 220)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 107, no. A168, pl. LXXIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.017) (Phase 1)
